resources.string: Point of Screen: Displays list of songs from the selected playlist. Provides the option to add song to user library or remove song from the playlist. \n\nTechnical hurdles: Shuffle playing the songs or modifying the list. Should the user choose to modify the list and shuffle play, then saving the shuffled order in a temporary storage without changing the main playlist.
Technical hurdle: Implementing swipe right for more albums or playlists
Point of Screen: Displays the lists of songs from the selected album. \n\nFacilitates the user to cherry pick songs to be added to the user\'s\ library
Point of Screen: Displays the song that is currently playing along with the song\'\s seekbar
This is where the seekbar along with audio control buttons go
Point of Screen: Displays list of Top Charts songs in chronological order.\n\nSong stats tile gives rich information like trending up/down icon, no of times favorited and the genre of the song

Point of Screen: Displays recommended audio content tailored to user tastes and preferences. The audio content would be presented in three categories, namely - Songs, Albums and Playlists \n\nTechnical hurdles: Building and integrating a recommender engine that accurately displays content per user tastes and preferences

Songs category would implement a vertical list view where each row would be a song card with song stats info.\nAlbums category would implement a horizontal scrollview of albums that are displayed as vinyl disks with the name of the album on the vinyl.\nPlaylists would implement a horizontal scroll view too with square tiles with playlist art and a scrim at the bottom with the name of the playlist. Each scrollable element would be registered to a listener, where each listener navigates to the now playing screen while beginning to play a song or album or playlist.

Point of Screen: Displays list of playlists that are grouped based on different genres and moods. This screen would be implemented as a vertical ScrollView with each row housing three playlist cards. Each playlist card would be designed with a playlist art, which would be super-imposed by the playlist\'s\ name and a small portion of the right side of the card will contain playlist stats, like how many times was it liked and its genre.

Each genre or mood based playlist opens up to its playlists screen. The purpose is to let the user view the songs in the playlist and allow the user to play a modified or default version of the same playlist.
